title: Very slow shutdown when uptime is high
body:
The shutdown is painfully slow when Nethermind has been running for a long time.
Here is an example after 30+ days of uptime (on v1.17.0):
```
2023-04-01 18:34:32.5202|INFO|23|Closing DBs... 
2023-04-01 18:34:32.5202|INFO|23|Disposing DB Blocks 
2023-04-01 18:35:31.5590|INFO|23|Disposing DB State0 
2023-04-01 18:36:26.8036|INFO|23|Disposing DB Metadata 
2023-04-01 18:37:10.6851|INFO|23|Disposing DB Bloom 
2023-04-01 18:38:38.7958|INFO|23|Disposing DB Headers 
2023-04-01 18:39:34.9636|INFO|23|Disposing DB Receipts 
2023-04-01 18:39:36.2464|INFO|23|Disposing DB Code 
2023-04-01 18:40:19.2184|INFO|23|Disposing DB Witness 
2023-04-01 18:40:19.2184|INFO|23|Disposing DB BlockInfos 
2023-04-01 18:41:13.6703|INFO|23|Disposing DB CanonicalHashTrie 
2023-04-01 18:41:13.6703|INFO|23|All DBs closed. 
2023-04-01 18:41:13.6703|INFO|23|Ethereum shutdown complete... please wait for all components to close 
2023-04-01 18:41:13.6703|INFO|23|All done, goodbye! 

```
During this time the CPU is saturated by the Nethermind process (100% on all cores).
This causes some problems when Windows tries to shutdown for OS updates.
Performance is excellent otherwise on this specific hardware (i7-12700 + 32 GB RAM + Samsung EVO Plus SSD).
Using the default config file on mainnet.
